when Ronald M. George became chief, warmed. His predecessor, Malcolm M. Lucas , had infuriated legislators with a ruling that upheld term limits. 8.44 billion for the quarter ended December 31, 2010, representing an increase of 26% compared to Q4 of 2009. "Q4 marked a terrific end to a stellar year," enthuses Eric Schmidt . Our strong performance has been driven by a rapidly growing digital economy, continuous product innovation that benefits both users and advertisers, and by the extraordinary momentum of our newer businesses, such as display and mobile. These results give us the optimism and confidence to invest heavily in future growth, investments that will benefit our users, Google and the wider Web. Breaking things down, Google-owned Websites accounted for the majority of the revenue generated at US$ 5.67 billion or 67%; up 28% from Q4 2009. a fictitious substance called "red mercury" that, according to local lore, can be found in the throats of ancient mummies. Some people think it has magical powers and can be used to summon spirits.
